question.question_name:
Is this a valid use of header.tag, a JSP tag file that is located in WEB-INF/tags? (1 correct answer)
<%@ taglib prefix="my" tagdir="/WEB-INF/tags" %> <html> <body> <my:header /> </body> </html>

Is this a valid use of header.tag, a JSP tag file that is located in WEB-INF/tags? (1 correct answer)
<%@ taglib prefix="my" tagdir="/WEB-INF/tags/
header.tag" %> <html> <body> <my:header /> </body> </html>

Is this a valid use of header.tag, a JSP tag file that is located in WEB-INF/tags? (1 correct answer)
<%@ taglib prefix="my" uri="/WEB-INF/tags" %> <html> <body> <my:header /> </body> </html>

Is this a valid use of header.tag, a JSP tag file that is located in WEB-INF/tags? (1 correct answer)
<%@ taglib prefix="my" uri="/WEB-INF/tags/
header.tag" %> <html> <body> <my:header /> </body> </html>

Is this a valid use of header.tag, a JSP tag file that is located in WEB-INF/tags? (1 correct answer)
<%@ taglib prefix="my" tagdir="/WEB-INF/tags/"
uri="http://nikojava.wordpress.com" %> <html> <body> <my:header /> </body> </html>

Is this a valid use of header.tag, a JSP tag file that is located in WEB-INF/tags? (1 correct answer)
<%@ taglib prefix="header" tagdir="/WEB-INF/ tags" %> <html> <body> <header:header /> </body> </html>

Is this a valid use of header.tag, a JSP tag file that is located in WEB-INF/tags? (1 correct answer)
<%@ taglib prefix="1" tagdir="/WEB-INF/tags" %> <html> <body> <1:header /> </body> </html>

Consider these files. <%-- WEB-INF/tags/header.tag --%>

Hello !!

<%-- output.jsp --%> <%@ taglib prefix="my" tagdir="/WEB-INF/tags" %> Is the declaration and use of the JSP tag file valid? (1 correct answer)

Consider these files. <%-- WEB-INF/tags/header.tag --%>

Hello ${Manoli}!!

<%-- output.jsp --%> <%@ taglib prefix="my" tagdir="/WEB-INF/tags" %> Is the declaration and use of the JSP tag file valid? (1 correct answer)

Consider these files. <%-- WEB-INF/tags/header.tag --%>

Hello ${name}!!

<%-- output.jsp --%> <%@ taglib prefix="my" tagdir="/WEB-INF/tags" %> Is the declaration and use of the JSP tag file valid? (1 correct answer)

Consider these files. <%-- WEB-INF/tags/header.tag --%> <%@ attribute name="name" %>

Hello ${name}!!

<%-- output.jsp --%> <%@ taglib prefix="my" tagdir="/WEB-INF/tags" %> Is the declaration and use of the JSP tag file valid? (1 correct answer)

Consider these files. <%-- WEB-INF/tags/header.tag --%> <%@ attribute name="name" %>

Hello ${name}!!

<%-- output.jsp --%> <%@ taglib prefix="my" tagdir="/WEB-INF/tags" %> Is the declaration and use of the JSP tag file valid? (1 correct answer)

Consider these files.
<%-- WEB-INF/tags/simple.tag --%> <%@ attribute name="city" required="false" %> <%@ tag pageEncoding="utf-8"%> This is ${city}.
<%-- output.jsp --%> <%@ taglib prefix="ayo" tagdir="/WEB-INF/tags" %> <html> <body> <ayo:simple city="Sparta"/> </body> </html>
What is the output? (1 correct answer)

Consider these files.
<%-- WEB-INF/tags/simple.tag --%> <%@ attribute name="city" required="true" %> <%@ tag pageEncoding="utf-8"%> This is ${city}.
<%-- output.jsp --%> <%@ taglib prefix="ayo" tagdir="/WEB-INF/tags" %> <html> <body> <ayo:simple/> </body> </html>
What is the output? (1 correct answer)

Consider these files.
<%-- WEB-INF/tags/simple.tag --%> <%@ attribute name="city" %> <%@ tag pageEncoding="utf-8"%> This is ${city}.
<%-- output.jsp --%> <%@ taglib prefix="ayo" tagdir="/WEB-INF/tags" %> <% request.setAttribute("city", "Sparta");%> <html> <body> <ayo:simple city="${city}"/> </body> </html>
What is the output? (1 correct answer)

Consider these files.
<%-- WEB-INF/tags/simple.tag --%> <%@ attribute name="city" rtexprvalue="false" %> <%@ tag pageEncoding="utf-8"%> This is ${city}.
<%-- output.jsp --%> <%@ taglib prefix="ayo" tagdir="/WEB-INF/tags" %> <% request.setAttribute("city", "Sparta");%> <html> <body> <ayo:simple city="${city}"/> </body> </html>
What is the output? (1 correct answer)

Consider these files.
<%-- WEB-INF/tags/simple.tag --%> <%@ attribute name="city" rtexprvalue="true" %> <%@ tag pageEncoding="utf-8"%> This is ${city}.
<%-- output.jsp --%> <%@ taglib prefix="ayo" tagdir="/WEB-INF/tags" %> <html> <body> <ayo:simple city="${1 ge 10}"/> </body> </html>
What is the output? (1 correct answer)

Consider these files.
<%-- WEB-INF/tags/simple.tag --%> <%@ attribute name="city" rtexprvalue="true" %> <%@ tag pageEncoding="utf-8"%> This is ${city}.
<%-- output.jsp --%> <%@ taglib prefix="ayo" tagdir="/WEB-INF/tags" %> <html> <body> <ayo:simple capital="${1 ge 10}"/> </body> </html>
What is the output? (1 correct answer)

Consider these files.
<%-- WEB-INF/tags/body.tag --%> Start <jsp:doBody /> End
<%-- output.jsp --%> <%@ taglib prefix="ayo" tagdir="/WEB-INF/tags" %> <html> <body> <ayo:body>Middle</ayo:body> </body> </html>
What is the output? (1 correct answer)

Consider these files.
<%-- WEB-INF/tags/body.tag --%> <%@ tag body-content="scriptless" %> Start <jsp:doBody /> End
<%-- output.jsp --%> <%@ taglib prefix="ayo" tagdir="/WEB-INF/tags" %> <% request.setAttribute("position", "Middle"); %> <html> <body> <ayo:body>${position}</ayo:body> </body> </html>
What is the output? (1 correct answer)

Consider these files.
<%-- WEB-INF/tags/body.tag --%> <%@ tag body-content="tagdependent" %> Start <jsp:doBody /> End
<%-- output.jsp --%> <%@ taglib prefix="ayo" tagdir="/WEB-INF/tags" %> <% request.setAttribute("position", "Middle"); %> <html> <body> <ayo:body><%= request.getAttribute("position") %></ayo:body> </body> </html>
What is the output? (1 correct answer)

SimpleTagSupport IS-A SimpleTag. (1 correct answer)
SimpleTagSupport IS-A JspTag. (1 correct answer)

question.question_name: Consider class SimpleTagSupport. What is the signature of its method doTag? (1 correct answer)

Consider a simple tag handler that is nested, has attributes and a body. Here are the actions taken by the Container when this tag is invoked. Place them in the correct order starting from what happens first.

<tag> <name>simple</name> <tag-class>simpletaghandlers.Test</tag-class> <body-content>empty</body-content> </tag>

<%@ taglib tagdir="/WEB-INF/" prefix="show"%> <html> <body> <show:simple /> </body> </html>

<%@ taglib tagdir="/webapp/mytaglib" prefix="show"%> <html> <body> <show:simple /> </body> </html>

mytaglib.tld is a valid TLD with <uri>/webapp/mytaglib</uri> and a simple tag handler with <name>simple</name>. Is this a valid use of the tag handler? (1 correct answer)
<%@ taglib uri="/webapp/mytaglib" prefix="show"%> <html> <body> <show:simple /> </body> </html>

TagSupport IS-A IterationTag. (1 correct answer)

The following are all fields of interface Tag. (1 correct answer) ⇒ SKIP_BODY ⇒ SKIP_PAGE ⇒ EVAL_PAGE ⇒ EVAL_BODY_INCLUDE
The following is a field of interface IterationTag. (1 correct answer) ⇒ EVAL_BODY_AGAIN

alternative.name: We should override the doEndTag() method.
The value returned by doStartTag() is not correct.
The doAfterBody() should not have a while loop inside.
The instance variables should be initialized in the doStartTag() method.
The doStartTag() and doAfterBody() methods should throw a JspException.

question.question_name: In EL you may use the . operator to access maps and beans.
In EL you may use the [] operator to access maps, beans, lists and arrays.
Which of the following are EL implicit objects? (4 correct answers)
Which of the following are EL implicit objects? (2 correct answers)
Which of the following are EL implicit objects? (1 correct answer)
Which of the following EL implicit objects are maps? (3 correct answers)

Consider this code.
<%-- input.jsp --%> <html> <body> <form action="output.jsp"> <input type="text" name="yourname" value="Bond"/> <input type="submit" value="OK" /> </form> </body> </html>
<%-- output.jsp --%> <html> <body> Hello ${yourname} !! </body> </html>
What is the output when the form is submitted? (1 correct answer)

Consider this code.
<%-- input.jsp --%> <html> <body> <form action="output.jsp"> <input type="text" name="yourname" value="Bond"/> <input type="submit" value="OK" /> </form> </body> </html>
<%-- output.jsp --%> <html> <body> Hello ${request.yourname} !! </body> </html>
What is the output when the form is submitted? (1 correct answer)

What is the output of this page? (1 correct answer)
<% request.setAttribute("list", new String[100]); %> <html> <body> Result is ${empty list} </body> </html>

What is the output of this page? (1 correct answer)
<% request.setAttribute("list", new String[0]); %> <html> <body> Result is ${empty list} </body> </html>

What is the output of this page? (1 correct answer)
<% String[] names = new String[]{"Rihanna", "Lopez", "Kylie"}; request.setAttribute("names", names); %> <html> <body> Hey ${request.names}!! </body> </html>

What is the output of this page? (1 correct answer)
<% String[] names = new String[]{"Rihanna", "Lopez", "Kylie"}; request.setAttribute("names", names); %> <html> <body> Hey ${request.names[0]}!! </body> </html>

What is the output of this page? (1 correct answer)
<% String[] names = new String[]{"Rihanna", "Lopez", "Kylie"}; request.setAttribute("names", names); %> <html> <body> Hey ${requestScope.names[0]}!! </body> </html>

What is the output of this page? (1 correct answer)
<% String[] names = new String[]{"Rihanna", "Lopez", "Kylie"}; request.setAttribute("names", names); %> <html> <body> Hey ${requestScope.names[12 - 12]}!! </body> </html>

What is the output of this page? (1 correct answer)
<% String[] names = new String[]{"Rihanna", "Lopez", "Kylie"}; request.setAttribute("names", names); %> <html> <body> Hey ${requestScope.names[<%= names.length - 2%>]}!! </body> </html>

What is the output of this page? (1 correct answer)
<% String[] names = new String[]{"Rihanna", "Lopez", "Kylie"}; request.setAttribute("names", names); %> <html> <body> Hey ${requestScope["names"]}!! </body> </html>

What is the output of this page? (1 correct answer)
<% String[] names = new String[]{"Rihanna", "Lopez", "Kylie"}; request.setAttribute("names", names); %> <html> <body> Hey ${requestScope["names"].0}!! </body> </html>

What is the output of this page? (1 correct answer)
<% String[] names = new String[]{"Rihanna", "Lopez", "Kylie"}; request.setAttribute("names", names); %> <html> <body> Hey ${requestScope["names"][0]}!! </body> </html>

What is the output of this page? (1 correct answer)
<% String[] names = new String[]{"Rihanna", "Lopez", "Kylie"}; request.setAttribute("names", names); %> <html> <body> Hey ${pageScope["names"][0]}!! </body> </html>

What is the output of this page? (1 correct answer)
<% String[] names = new String[]{"Rihanna", "Lopez", "Kylie"}; request.setAttribute("names", names); %> <html> <body> Hey ${names[0]}!! </body> </html>

What is the output of this page? (1 correct answer)
<% request.setAttribute("1007", Integer.valueOf(10)); %> <html> <body> Number is ${1007}!! </body> </html>

What is the output of this page? (1 correct answer)
<% request.setAttribute("1007", Integer.valueOf(10)); %> <html> <body> Number is ${"1007"}!! </body> </html>

What is the output of this page? (1 correct answer)
<% request.setAttribute("1007", Integer.valueOf(10)); %> <html> <body> Number is ${requestScope["1007"]}!! </body> </html>

What is the output of this code? (1 correct answer)
<% session.setAttribute("email", "session@info"); application.setAttribute("email", "application@info"); %> <html> <body> Contact an administrator at ${email}. </body> </html>

What is the output of this code? (1 correct answer)
<% request.setAttribute("email", "request@info"); session.setAttribute("email", "session@info"); %> <html> <body> Contact an administrator at ${email}. </body> </html>

What is the output of this code? (1 correct answer)
<% request.setAttribute("email", null); session.setAttribute("email", "session@info"); %> <html> <body> Contact an administrator at ${email}. </body> </html>

<%= session == pageContext.getSession() %>

What is the output of the following code? (1 correct answer)
<%= request == pageContext.getRequest() %>

What is the output of the following code? (1 correct answer)
<%= page instanceof JspPage %>

What is the output of the following code? (1 correct answer)
<%= out instanceof JspWriter %>

Consider this code.
package library; public class Book { private String title; public Book() {} // get and set methods }
<%-- input.jsp --%> <html> <body> <form action="output.jsp"> <input type="text" name="about" value="Mathematics"/> <input type="submit" value="OK" /> </form> </body> </html>
<%-- output.jsp --%> <jsp:useBean id="book" class="library.Book" scope="request" /> <html> <body> I like <jsp:getProperty name="book" property="title" />! </body> </html>
What is the output when the form is submitted? (1 correct answer)

Consider this code.
package library; public class Book { private String title; public Book() {} // get and set methods }
<%-- input.jsp --%> <html> <body> <form action="output.jsp"> <input type="text" name="about" value="Mathematics"/> <input type="submit" value="OK" /> </form> </body> </html>
<%-- output.jsp --%> <jsp:useBean id="book" class="library.Book" scope="request" /> <jsp:setProperty name="book" property="title" param="title" /> <html> <body> I like <jsp:getProperty name="book" property="title" />! </body> </html>
What is the output when the form is submitted? (1 correct answer)

Consider this code.
package library; public class Book { private String title; public Book() {} // get and set methods }
<%-- input.jsp --%> <html> <body> <form action="output.jsp"> <input type="text" name="about" value="Mathematics"/> <input type="submit" value="OK" /> </form> </body> </html>
<%-- output.jsp --%> <jsp:useBean id="book" class="library.Book" scope="request" /> <jsp:setProperty name="book" property="title" param="about" /> <html> <body> I like <jsp:getProperty name="book" property="title" />! </body> </html>
What is the output when the form is submitted? (1 correct answer)

question.question_name: Here are some actions taken by the Container when a client request arrives. Place them in the correct order starting from what happens first.
How can a servlet access it’s associated ServletConfig object? (1 correct answer)
How can a servlet access the application’s ServletContext object? (3 correct answers)
How is a request dispatchedto hello.jsp from a doGet() method? (1 correct answer)
How is a request redirectedto hello.jsp from a doGet() method? (1 correct answer)
Dispatching a request occurs on the server-side and redirection on the client-side. (1 correct answer)
Both context init parameters and servlet init parameters are declared in the web.xml. (1 correct answer)
The value of a servlet init parameter can be changed programmatically, but the value of a context init parameter cannot. (1 correct answer)
A context init parameter cannot have the same name with a servlet init parameter. (1 correct answer)
A servlet init parameter cannot have the same name with the servlet it refers to. (1 correct answer)

alternative.name: In the ServletConfig object of the servlet.
In the ServletContext object of the web application.

alternative.name: In the ServletConfig object of the servlet.
In the ServletContext object of the web application.

alternative.name: No, because servlet-name contains a space.
No, because servlet-class has a wrong value.
No, because param-name is a reserved Java keyword.
No, because param-value contains an explanation mark (!).
No, because init-param should be inside a servlet-mapping element.

question.question_name:
Assume the servlet HelloServlet that belongs to package com. The file HelloServlet.class is placed in the directory WEB-INF/classes/com. Is this a correct declaration of an init parameter for this servlet? (1 correct answer)
<servlet> <servlet-name>Hello Servlet</servlet-name> <servlet-class>classes.com.HelloServlet</servlet-class> <init-param> <param-name>this</param-name> <param-value>Hello!</param-value> </init-param> </servlet>
